Agriculture

Le Web fait pousser mes tomates

Quels points communs entre la permaculture et la qualité Web ?

Cet article est la transcription de la conférence que j’ai eu l’occasion de présenter à Paris Web 2014.

J’ai pu parler des liens entre les bonnes pratiques de la permaculture et du Web devant un par-terre d’experts du Web, au Beffroi de Montrouge.

[Lire la suite]

agritecture:

Be A Martian! Farmers Wanted by NASA for Mars Colony

Our friends at Heliospectra posted this on LinkedIn today and mentioned the only thing missing from this recruiting poster are the LEDs! Its been a big week for Mars exploration with the live Space-X keynote by Elon Musk and the revelation of bold plans to terraform Mars. Controlled Environment Agriculture will play a major role, creating yet another reason to invest in your abilities to grow food hydroponically indoors. Do you have what it takes?

Mars needs YOU! In the future, Mars will need all kinds of explorers, farmers, surveyors, teachers … but most of all YOU! Join us on the Journey to Mars as we explore with robots and send humans there one day. Download a Mars poster that speaks to you. Be an explorer!

SOURCE

motherearthnewsmag:

Country Lore: Dig a Bucket-Size Root Cellar

A 5-gallon bucket and bucket-size hole are all you need to make a simple root cellar for carrots.

By Chriss Stutzman

ILLUSTRATION: KRISTIN HURLIN

I remember watching Family Outing and in  some of the villages, they used those giant ceramic kimchi jars in fields to hold vegetables for the denizens over winter. I thought that was pretty neat and a good way to make sure everyone in the village has food for winter.

How can aeroponics be used for urban farming education?

agritecture:

This blog post was written by Camille Richman, an undergrad researcher at the MIT CityFARM.

In January 2014, MIT CityFARM and the Ecological Greenhouse at Kibbutz Ein Shemer in Israel collaborated on an initiative to build an educational aeroponic farming program. Sponsored by MIT…
